comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The term "Suffragettes" identified the British contingent in the woman's suffrage struggle. In the USA at that time they were called "Suffragists."

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan: Thank you for your comment!  While the caption cards for the Bain Collection do use the term 'suffragettes' as a subject heading, the Library of Congress now uses 'suffragists'.  We will adjust the descriptive information accordingly since this is a title (indicated by the square brackets) devised by our cataloging staff.
